<!-- This is a WordPress eXtended RSS file generated by WordPress as an export of your blog. -->
<!-- It contains information about your blog's posts, comments, and categories. -->
<!-- You may use this file to transfer that content from one site to another. -->
<!-- This file is not intended to serve as a complete backup of your blog. -->

<!-- To import this information into a WordPress blog follow these steps. -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that blog as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the blog's admin panels (or Manage: Import in older versions of WordPress). -->
<!-- 3. Choose "WordPress" from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 5. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the blog.  For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the blog or to create a new user -->
<!-- 6. WordPress will then import each of the posts, comments, and categories -->
<!--    contained in this file into your blog -->

<!-- generator="WordPress/3.0.3" created="2010-12-19 06:36"-->

		<item>
		<title>DIY iPhone cardboard dock</title>

		<title>呢舊嘢又真係幾好玩架喎</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Quite nice for the price. Sound quality is good, not very tight when wearing. 		<content:encoded><![CDATA[waited for like 2 weeks, finally got it :)))<br />next time ill definately go for express post, just few bucks more and still like $40 cheaper, EB is selling like 108, crazy <br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwNRtWydcmI/AAAAAAAABr0/ICi4b3fU0iI/s1600/IMG_0287%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwNRtWydcmI/AAAAAAAABr0/ICi4b3fU0iI/s320/IMG_0287%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwNRtb95nEI/AAAAAAAABrw/Os3QV-kvqxk/s1600/IMG_0286%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwNRtb95nEI/AAAAAAAABrw/Os3QV-kvqxk/s320/IMG_0286%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Dragon Age Origins - play</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2009/11/dragon-age-origins-play.html</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2009 02:16:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Dragon Age Origins]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dragon-age-origins"><![CDATA[Dragon Age Origins]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=11</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[basically it's a 3D buldar's gate, while Neverwinter Nights(NWN) story is less flexible and combat is more real-timed, this Dragon Age Origins is more like old Buldar's Gate while you get a lot more story telling and conversations during your adventure. Bioware had done a great job on making super high resolution character models (especially faces), it really feels like watching a movie during all those in-game cut scenes. If you liked Buldar's Gate and those NWN type of "pause and fight" RPG games, you will like this.<br />Seems it really needs a nice computer to play lol, I've set everything to highest on my Geforce 275 and it does get a bit tear and short lag at some point but not very often.<br /><br />Story Screenshots after the break<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5VfPXQdI/AAAAAAAABuc/b6Si-QOzXBk/s1600/Elissa1_272.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5VfPXQdI/AAAAAAAABuc/b6Si-QOzXBk/s320/Elissa1_272.jpg" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5W3f-xdI/AAAAAAAABug/S5J4cP0eZ1s/s1600/Elissa1_273.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5W3f-xdI/AAAAAAAABug/S5J4cP0eZ1s/s320/Elissa1_273.jpg" /></a><a href="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5QVft_PI/AAAAAAAABuQ/GFOig8pf3QY/s1600/Elissa1_244.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5QVft_PI/AAAAAAAABuQ/GFOig8pf3QY/s320/Elissa1_244.jpg" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">Combat / Venturing Screenshots</div><div style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5awXkFDI/AAAAAAAABuo/HY9wcg3Qx3k/s1600/Elissa1_395992.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5awXkFDI/AAAAAAAABuo/HY9wcg3Qx3k/s320/Elissa1_395992.jpg" /></a><span id="goog_1258683515226"></span><span id="goog_1258683515227"></span></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5d5q9wcI/AAAAAAAABuw/lh8lOPhQYOM/s1600/Elissa1_378721.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh6.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5d5q9wcI/AAAAAAAABuw/lh8lOPhQYOM/s320/Elissa1_378721.jpg" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5frGxfpI/AAAAAAAABu4/DSSLE7hZJ4Q/s1600/Elissa1_395986.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwX5frGxfpI/AAAAAAAABu4/DSSLE7hZJ4Q/s320/Elissa1_395986.jpg" /></a></div>Damn I'm addicted to this now, lol<br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>11</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-11-20 02:16:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-11-20 02:16:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Dragon Age Origins - more</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2009/11/dragon-age-origins-more.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Nov 2009 01:37:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Dragon Age Origins]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dragon-age-origins"><![CDATA[Dragon Age Origins]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=12</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[wow just discover this "cinematic finishing move" thingy, seems random on smaller creatures but very likely happening on big creatures. For small creatures it's like chopping its head off, slice its chest and blood everywhere, etc etc, for big creatures such as dragons, ogres, it's something like...<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2u1BosKI/AAAAAAAABxY/gDuQSWi-YUo/s1600/Screenshot20091123093926736.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2u1BosKI/AAAAAAAABxY/gDuQSWi-YUo/s320/Screenshot20091123093926736.jpg" /></a><a href="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2wKdHTdI/AAAAAAAABxc/ucKDa3jy1zs/s1600/Screenshot20091124025452425.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2wKdHTdI/AAAAAAAABxc/ucKDa3jy1zs/s320/Screenshot20091124025452425.jpg" /></a><a href="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2xm4xrCI/AAAAAAAABxg/vtqqsQsiv7o/s1600/Screenshot20091124025457526.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sws2xm4xrCI/AAAAAAAABxg/vtqqsQsiv7o/s320/Screenshot20091124025457526.jpg" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">pretty cool!&nbsp;</div><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>LED Headlight!</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2009/11/led-headlight.html</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Nov 2009 02:46:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[car]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="car"><![CDATA[car]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=13</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[a friend got 2 LED headlight for his car, and i thought "Damn, so white so nice!", so got myself a pair.<br />$24 for 2 inc postage, not expensive at all :) Hope it lasts long<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOKyLsEI/AAAAAAAABxs/d5VgxUcI_LU/s1600/IMG_0288%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOKyLsEI/AAAAAAAABxs/d5VgxUcI_LU/s320/IMG_0288%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">18 little LEDs there, exactly same plug as normal H4 bulbs, so just plug and play</div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><br /></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">more pictures after the break </div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"></div><a name='more'></a><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">&nbsp;<a href="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOcgS6iI/AAAAAAAABxw/1lcZ7YBaX5o/s1600/IMG_0289%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh4.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOcgS6iI/AAAAAAAABxw/1lcZ7YBaX5o/s320/IMG_0289%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">very white </div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOhq4pWI/AAAAAAAABx0/Nx5Kd6mxA-Y/s1600/IMG_0290%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://lh3.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SwyYOhq4pWI/AAAAAAAABx0/Nx5Kd6mxA-Y/s320/IMG_0290%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">looks quite dispersed like this, need to see how it's like at night</div><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Shiny car!</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2009/11/car-is-shiny.html</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 27 Nov 2009 07:30:00 +0000</pubDate>

		<category domain="category" nicename="car"><![CDATA[car]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=14</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[finally got the mood to do this, it was like months since my last wash.. at machine, lol<br />first rinse was like washing a road, jet was like pushing some black water, omg.<br />saw thomas and went to try his polish machine thingy<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SxAMHSUGY7I/AAAAAAAAB2U/pMAAjm0pm0U/s1600/IMG_0292%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SxAMHSUGY7I/AAAAAAAAB2U/pMAAjm0pm0U/s320/IMG_0292%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br />gonna take a picture when it's still shiny, lol<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SxAMlo3XdoI/AAAAAAAAB2c/YmIUh7or6Ak/s1600/IMG_0295%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/SxAMlo3XdoI/AAAAAAAAB2c/YmIUh7or6Ak/s320/IMG_0295%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool - cleans up mess after playing with linux partition on a USB drive</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2009/12/hp-usb-disk-storage-format-tool-cleans-up-mess-after-playing-with-linux-partition-on-a-usb-drive.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 01 Dec 2009 04:50:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[software]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=15</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This small tool wipes everything on the USB drive or any flash memory card and convert into FAT, FAT32 or NTFS. It works even on my win 7 x64, probabily works on most windows i guess.<br />Pretty useful piece of software to clean up those linux partitions after playing with any linux image or ChromeOS. Screenshot after the break<br /><br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://www.ghacks.net/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/usb_disk_storage.gif" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="320" src="http://www.ghacks.net/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/usb_disk_storage.gif" width="237" /></a></div><a href="http://www.pcworld.com/downloads/file/fid,64963-order,4/description.html">http://www.pcworld.com/downloads/file/fid,64963-order,4/description.html</a><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>15</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-12-01 04:50:00</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<item>
		<title>$200 3 Points</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/01/200-3-points.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 02 Jan 2010 09:35:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[car]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="car"><![CDATA[car]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=18</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sz8TP5IS0cI/AAAAAAAAFRY/j5OOeZYVDE8/s1600-h/IMG_0338%5B9%5D.jpg"><img alt="IMG_0338" height="360" src="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/Sz8TQ-HKTiI/AAAAAAAAFRg/NNfch9UIp6g/IMG_0338_thumb%5B7%5D.jpg?imgmax=800" style="display: block; float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" title="IMG_0338" width="480" /></a> <br />拍照留個念<br /><br /><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>L4d2 nice</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/01/l4d2-nice.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Jan 2010 22:06:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[game]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="game"><![CDATA[game]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=19</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0Ghapgtd1I/AAAAAAAAFRs/CGoi6tefOU8/s1600-h/left4dead2+2010-01-04+18-05-10-09.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0Ghapgtd1I/AAAAAAAAFRs/CGoi6tefOU8/s320/left4dead2+2010-01-04+18-05-10-09.jpg" /></a></div><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Torchlight – yet another arpg before diablo 3</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/01/torchlight-yet-another-arpg-before-diablo-3.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Jan 2010 23:34:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[game]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="game"><![CDATA[game]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=20</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"></div>ARPG just like Diablo, hack and slash style, but in 3D and comic style arts. kinda like <a href="http://games.wildtangent.com/fate/">Fate</a>, but enemies with slightly darker demonic "diabloish" tone, levels randomly generated except important bosses. Single player only. Surprisingly addictive. Some screenshots after the break.<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX1YpjC6I/AAAAAAAAFR0/FKINxmJju20/s1600/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-01-17.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="193" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX1YpjC6I/AAAAAAAAFR0/FKINxmJju20/s320/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-01-17.jpg" width="320" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX36-jR9I/AAAAAAAAFSE/5OkcVBC1O-o/s1600-h/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-40-42.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="193" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX36-jR9I/AAAAAAAAFSE/5OkcVBC1O-o/s320/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-40-42.jpg" width="320" /></a></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX26zeA2I/AAAAAAAAFR8/6gUtnQc8oFY/s1600-h/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-27-09.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="193" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S0RX26zeA2I/AAAAAAAAFR8/6gUtnQc8oFY/s320/Torchlight+2010-01-06+19-27-27-09.jpg" width="320" /></a></div><br /><a href="http://www.torchlightgame.com/%20">http://www.torchlightgame.com/ </a><br /><br />$5.00 on Steam<br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>有野食 - 臘味蘿蔔糕</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/02/%e6%9c%89%e9%87%8e%e9%a3%9f-%e8%87%98%e5%91%b3%e8%98%bf%e8%94%94%e7%b3%95.html</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Feb 2010 11:37:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[food]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="food"><![CDATA[food]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=21</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S3vUul0eLhI/AAAAAAAAFwg/fVS2u5fVB9s/s1600-h/IMG_0362.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 1em;"><img border="0" height="240" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S3vUul0eLhI/AAAAAAAAFwg/fVS2u5fVB9s/s320/IMG_0362.JPG" width="320" /></a>話說自由人心血來潮想整下野食, 過年最好都係蒸糕, 都唔係幾難, 係刨蘿蔔刨到手軟<br /><br />材料:<br />白蘿蔔-------- 1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 公斤<br />臘腸+臘肉---- 250&nbsp;&nbsp; 克 <br />蝦米----------- 50&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 克 <br />粘米粉-------- 340&nbsp;&nbsp; 克<br />粟粉----------- 75&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 克<br />清水----------- 1.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 公斤<br />鹽-------------- 20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 克<br />胡椒粉,麻油 -- 少許<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br />製法:<br />(1) 蝦米乾先浸水. 白蘿蔔去皮後淨1.2公斤, 把它刨成粗絲. 臘腸, 臘肉切粒. 準備容器, 內部掃上生油.<br />(2) 取出600克清水混和粘米粉,粟粉; <br />(3) 起鍋加生油100克大火炒香蝦米,&nbsp; 臘腸, 臘肉粒, 後注入餘下清水, 放下蘿蔔絲, 待水滾後加入味,鹽,胡椒粉,麻油, 再把火轉慢, 隨隨加入600 克漿粉水拌勻, 不要燒滾, 當粉漿呈現半生時起出倒入容器內掃平, 再置於蒸籠內蒸1小時後可起出.<br />(4) 待蘿蔔糕泠卻凝固後, 可以切件蒸或煎食用.<br /><br /><br />如上份量大約填滿 4 x 750 ml 容器<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S3ydbHxYhbI/AAAAAAAAFyQ/r31Jrskhw8Y/s1600-h/IMG_0364%5B1%5D.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S3ydbHxYhbI/AAAAAAAAFyQ/r31Jrskhw8Y/s320/IMG_0364%5B1%5D.JPG" /></a></div><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"></div><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>21</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-02-17 11:37:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-02-17 11:37:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>%e6%9c%89%e9%87%8e%e9%a3%9f-%e8%87%98%e5%91%b3%e8%98%bf%e8%94%94%e7%b3%95</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_blog</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[ycfreeman.blogspot.com]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_author</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Freeman Manhttp://www.blogger.com/profile/00374233293777008327freegod725@yahoo.com.hk]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_permalink</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/2010/02/blog-post.html]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1292730859]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_shortUrl</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[http://bit.ly/eUIU8w]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_permaHash</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[044f0986f566dd60dc54a9e9eb46f051]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Widgetbox + Facebook Page + static FBML box</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/04/widgetbox-facebook-page-static-fbml-box.html</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Apr 2010 01:09:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="web-design"><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So I finally got the time and mood to put a little bit work on this problem.    <br /><br />While there's seem to be very few clear tutorial or some sort in google specifically for this matter, I thought it would be either too simple that no one bothers to give a tutorial, or simply too complicated that no one bothers to do it.     <br /><br />Widgetbox is a useful site that allow you to create some dynamic content to your website in widget form, or simply use those widgets that created by someone else. Every time you want to insert a widget in widgetbox, simply copy the embed code generated and paste to the place you want to add. It works like charm for most contents like blog, website, etc.     <br /><br />However, as its code contains external script and object tag, it simply violates Facebook's terms of page contents... aka, it does not work with Facebook page, if you directly copy and paste those codes into that static FBML box (<a href="http://www.snipe.net/2009/06/fb-fanpages-fbml-box/">here's some info about it</a>). So this "new" Facebook page has banned most sort of external scripts and objects, so the generated embed code which consist of "object" and "script"     <br />tags just simply doesn't work on static FBML boxes.     <br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br />"but Facebook says they support swf!", Yes they support swf, in a weird way. First, you have to use FB:SWF to include the flash object, Second, it does not play on page load.     <br /><br />So the way to solve this problem is to convert fill in those variables in that object tag into the fb:swf tag. Ya simple as that.     <br /><br />now here's what you get from widgetbox "embed" button<br /><br /><pre>&lt;object classid=&quot;clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000&quot; 
<br /> codebase=&quot;http://fpdownload.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=9,0,0,0&quot; 
<br /> type=&quot;application/x-shockwave-flash&quot; 
<br /> width=&quot;350px&quot; height=&quot;523px&quot; 
<br /> id=&quot;InsertWidget_883e1e81-33bf-42ba-a364-985360a915e3&quot; 
<br /> align=&quot;middle&quot;&gt; &lt;param name=&quot;movie&quot; 
<br /> value=&quot;http://widgetserver.com/syndication/flash/wrapper/InsertWidget.swf&quot;&gt;
<br />    &lt;param name=&quot;quality&quot; 
<br /> value=&quot;high&quot;&gt;
<br />   &lt;param name=&quot;wmode&quot; value=&quot;transparent&quot;&gt;
<br />    &lt;param name=&quot;menu&quot; value=&quot;false&quot;&gt;
<br />    &lt;param name=&quot;flashvars&quot; value=&quot;r=2&amp;appId=883e1e81-33bf-42ba-a364-985360a915e3&quot;&gt;
<br />    &lt;param name=&quot;allowScriptAccess&quot; value=&quot;sameDomain&quot;&gt;
<br />    &lt;embed src=&quot;http://widgetserver.com/syndication/flash/wrapper/InsertWidget.swf&quot; 
<br /> name=&quot;InsertWidget_883e1e81-33bf-42ba-a364-985360a915e3&quot; 
<br /> width=&quot;350px&quot; height=&quot;523px&quot; quality=&quot;high&quot; menu=&quot;false&quot;
<br />    pluginspage=&quot;http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer&quot; 
<br /> type=&quot;application/x-shockwave-flash&quot; wmode=&quot;transparent&quot; align=&quot;middle&quot; 
<br /> allowscriptaccess=&quot;sameDomain&quot; 
<br /> flashvars=&quot;r=2&amp;appId=883e1e81-33bf-42ba-a364-985360a915e3&quot; /&gt; &lt;/object&gt;
<br /></pre><br /><br /><br />pretty much clear on how to convert here now :) , just change embed tag to fb:swf, and delete some not allowed parameters, then convert those like src to swfsrc. And finally add a printscreen or something to be the “lid of your hot pot”.<br /><br />the converted code would be something like this:<br /><br /><pre>&lt;fb:swf
<br /> imgsrc='http://img36.imageshack.us/img36/2045/playbuttonm.jpg'
<br /> swfsrc='http://widgetserver.com/syndication/flash/wrapper/InsertWidget.swf'
<br /> flashvars='r=2&amp;appId=883e1e81-33bf-42ba-a364-985360a915e3'
<br /> width='350' height='500'
<br /> align='middle'
<br /> wmode='transparent'
<br /> waitforclick='false'
<br /> scale='exactfit' 
<br />/&gt;
<br /></pre><br /><br /><br />Here's the result page:<br /><a href="http://www.facebook.com/durianclub?v=app_4949752878">http://www.facebook.com/durianclub?v=app_4949752878</a> <br /><br />one more thing, you can always test those FBML codes at <a href="http://developers.facebook.com/tools.php?fbml">FBML test console</a> before publish :)<br /><br />update: FBML test console is no longer working :(<br /><br />Have fun!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>22</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-04-01 01:09:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-04-01 01:09:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>widgetbox-facebook-page-static-fbml-box</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>

		<item>
		<title>Random 3360×1050 Wallpaper in Windows 7</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/04/3360x1050-wallpaper-in-windows-7.html</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Apr 2010 02:42:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[windows 7]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="windows-7"><![CDATA[windows 7]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=23</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you manage to have two 22 inch wide screen monitors like me, you probably have done the some search for dual wide screen wallpapers. Here is a quick Google link: <br /><a href="http://images.google.com.au/images?hl=en&amp;q=3360x1050%20wallpapers&amp;um=1&amp;ie=UTF-8&amp;sa=N&amp;tab=wi#start=0&amp;imgw=3360&amp;imgh=1050&amp;tbo=1">http://images.google.com.au/images?hl=en&amp;q=3360x1050%20wallpapers&amp;um=1&amp;ie=UTF-8&amp;sa=N&amp;tab=wi#start=0&amp;imgw=3360&amp;imgh=1050&amp;tbo=1</a><br /><br /><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8MUbZgzCBI/AAAAAAAAGZQ/fhFBMbRziec/s1600/randomwallpaper.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 1em;"><img border="0" height="200" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8MUbZgzCBI/AAAAAAAAGZQ/fhFBMbRziec/s320/randomwallpaper.JPG" width="320" /></a>I'm here to talk about what to do after you've picked a few nice one :).<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><br />"What software should I download to use it?" the answer is you don't need to download anything!<br /><br />Windows 7 "sort of" supports this kind of cross screen wallpaper. I say sort of because it does not have an option says "make wallpaper span to all screens" or something, but you can do a little trick to make it fit.<br /><br />The trick is very simple,<b> <i>just set it as Tile</i></b>.<br /><br />Yes, it is that simple, you can even have random dual wide screen wallpaper without installing any wallpaper managing software!<br /><br /><br />Here are the steps:<br />1. Put all your wallpapers into a folder<br />2. Go to Personalization &gt; Desktop Background - there are several ways to get to this page, one of them is to right click your desktop and choose Personalize<br />3. Setup Picture Location to your wallpaper folder through Browse... button<br />4. Tick all wallpapers you want to use<br />5. Set Picture position to Tile, tick Shuffle, and choose timer<br />6. Tada! you've got your random dual wide screen wallpaper!<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8MURbdxLiI/AAAAAAAAGZI/gkGXwdD63Oc/s1600/screenshot.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="125" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8MURbdxLiI/AAAAAAAAGZI/gkGXwdD63Oc/s400/screenshot.jpg" width="400" /></a></div><br />unfortunately the taskbar still won't span to the other screen, but it's not very necessary imo :)<br /><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>23</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-04-12 12:42:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-04-12 02:42:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>3360x1050-wallpaper-in-windows-7</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_blog</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[ycfreeman.blogspot.com]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_author</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Freeman Manhttp://www.blogger.com/profile/00374233293777008327freegod725@yahoo.com.hk]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_permalink</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/2010/04/3360x1050-wallpaper-in-windows-7.html]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Pocket Legends - MMO hack and slash on iPhone!</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/04/pocket-legends-mmo-hack-and-slash-on-iphone.html</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Apr 2010 09:08:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=24</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8Vo5k-osyI/AAAAAAAAGZY/p1FiFvry4F4/s1600/IMG_0422.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="clear: left; float: left; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8Vo5k-osyI/AAAAAAAAGZY/p1FiFvry4F4/s320/IMG_0422.PNG" /></a></div>Wo! omg it's MMORPG (Massively-Multiplayer Online Role-Play Game) on iPhone! With the launch of iPad, means even more gamers or potential gamers would be using this iPhone OS platform, gaming companies finally begin to make some "true" games. Not an old school arcade type of short games, not a lame bluetooth multiplayer game that requires you to sit right next to your component, not a lan only multiplayer game that require everyone to pay $8 before you can have fun, instead, we get a Free MMORPG with purchasable items and contents. Hurray! Short review after the break :)<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br />While this is actually pretty much similar to other MMORPG games, I will just review some of the interesting aspects of putting it on an iPhone. <br /><br /><br /><b>Control</b><br /><br />Most important of them is of course, Control.<br /><br /><br /><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8VvLfj5QKI/AAAAAAAAGZg/mO3L5fu9HA8/s1600/IMG_0430.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8VvLfj5QKI/AAAAAAAAGZg/mO3L5fu9HA8/s320/IMG_0430.PNG" /></a>Think of it as an ordinary hand-held console type ARPG, controls are fairly straight forward if you have played those kind of games.<br /><br />Top left corner we have a character nameplate, which can access to  character sheet, skills and shops. Below that there are hp/mp bars of  your party members. Top middle we have a chat button. Beside that we can see the chat window with some item log.<br /><br />At Bottom, we have on-screen D-pad on the left, right side we have a spell book button, 1 big attack button and 4 special ability buttons.<br /><br />There are some smaller buttons for some "less often used" actions, on the left side, we have a emotion button above d-pad for some non-combat actions like wave or smile, at bottom, we can toggle map, and can access to hp/mp potions. <br /><br />Furthermore, you can swipe to rotate camera view, and pinch to zoom in and out. <br /><br />Buttons are very packed so it is pretty easy to press the wrong button when you just started to play this.<br /><br /><br /><b>Store </b><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WA-0KTU4I/AAAAAAAAGaI/to7zlBfcOz4/s1600/IMG_0434.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WA-0KTU4I/AAAAAAAAGaI/to7zlBfcOz4/s320/IMG_0434.PNG" /></a></div>For a MMORPG for Free without pop up ads, obviously they will have something to earn your money, and like most iPhone games nowadays, you can have in-game purchases for just a few taps. Free version of the game includes one dungeon of 13 levels, additional dungeon packs can be bought for a few bucks each. Some other things you buy are like extra character slot, more emote actions, and of course some special items. However I do not think you need to buy those extra items, but dungeon packs are worth taking if you want to support their company.<br /><br /><br /><b>How is it?</b><br /><br />So what do I think about it? The idea or showing iPhone's potential of handling MMORPG is great, and they really have done a great job on making it smooth like you would have on a computer, but the game itself is a bit too simple.<br /><br />Gameplay is pretty basic, you venture through dungeon, kill enemies for experience, gold and equipments. You literally just kill enough mobs to advance a level. Item drop is really random, named mob (sort of boss) will not give you better loot.<br /><br />The town basically does nothing but only to show possibility to handle many players on same screen.<br /><br />And of course, at the end it still drains battery like any other 3D games and you will have to plug a cable if you want to spend some time on it :) <br /><br />Overall if you are a really big fan of hack and slash ARPG, you will find it fun. It is also exciting to see the potential of games with longer play time appear on mobile phones.<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WExVLj43I/AAAAAAAAGaQ/pNPhsq-f0W0/s1600/IMG_0433.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WExVLj43I/AAAAAAAAGaQ/pNPhsq-f0W0/s200/IMG_0433.PNG" width="200" /></a><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE0uJl0tI/AAAAAAAAGaY/dPSCK0z5YdE/s1600/IMG_0437.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE0uJl0tI/AAAAAAAAGaY/dPSCK0z5YdE/s200/IMG_0437.PNG" width="200" /></a><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE-frOXjI/AAAAAAAAGao/n9McsEXmz7E/s1600/IMG_0442.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE-frOXjI/AAAAAAAAGao/n9McsEXmz7E/s200/IMG_0442.PNG" width="200" /></a><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE5rb4oXI/AAAAAAAAGag/CMZy_lQQtJo/s1600/IMG_0439.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WE5rb4oXI/AAAAAAAAGag/CMZy_lQQtJo/s200/IMG_0439.PNG" width="200" /></a><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WFhxWPKkI/AAAAAAAAGa4/MeUhRit4JNU/s1600/IMG_0443.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WFhxWPKkI/AAAAAAAAGa4/MeUhRit4JNU/s200/IMG_0443.PNG" width="200" /></a><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WFkdqx5UI/AAAAAAAAGbA/9A_xXDDgNU4/s1600/IMG_0428.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="133" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S8WFkdqx5UI/AAAAAAAAGbA/9A_xXDDgNU4/s200/IMG_0428.PNG" width="200" /></a></div><br /><br /><br /><script type="text/javascript"><!--google_ad_client = "pub-9325509044951275";/* 468x60, created 4/9/10 */google_ad_slot = "6358062181";google_ad_width = 468;google_ad_height = 60;//--></script><br /><script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"></script>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget 1.0</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/05/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-10.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 09 May 2010 00:13:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="guild-recruitment"><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wordpress-plugin"><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-recruit-widget"><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=25</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>
<div>
<div>for more information about this plugin please go to:</div>
</div>
<div>
<div><a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/p/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget</a></div>
</div>
</strong></span>

This widget requires wordpress 2.8+, works perfectly for my guild site which runs 2.9.2.

Tested on 3.0 b1, b2, single site and multi sites, all working perfectly :)

<strong>Update 5/29/2010: seems fine on 3.0 RC1 as well. I'm rewriting many codes and remaking configuration  to support sorting and multiple entries per class. hopefully this major update can be finished when 3.0 goes live or soon after</strong>

Download from wordpress plugin gallery :): <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/</a>

Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~

<a name="more"></a>
<div>== Changelog ==</div>
<div>= 1.0 =</div>
<div>* First released version</div>
<div>= 1.0.1 =</div>
<div>* minor changes to path handling, added some simple URL validation, and some descriptions in widget</div>
<div style="text-align: center;">
<div style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">
</span></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">High Priority ToDos:</div>
<ul>
	<li style="text-align: left;">multiple slots for each class</li>
</ul>
<div style="text-align: left;">Possible Improvements:</div>
<ul>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">Custom icon</span></li>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">Toggle icon toggle class name</span></li>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">Custom order</span></li>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">URL validation</span></li>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">Custom status text?</span></li>
	<li style="text-align: left;"><span style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">Selectable different layout?</span></li>
</ul>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>JQuery slider with blogger</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/05/jquery-slider-with-blogger.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 May 2010 05:53:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="web-design"><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=26</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img alt="Capture" height="290" src="http://lh5.ggpht.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/S_IrOlnMa7I/AAAAAAAAG80/d7wtPIH_p1E/Capture%5B6%5D.jpg?imgmax=800" style="display: block; float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" title="Capture" width="400" />   <br />gonna love jquery<br /><a href="http://sixrevisions.com/tutorials/javascript_tutorial/create-a-slick-and-accessible-slideshow-using-jquery/">http://sixrevisions.com/tutorials/javascript_tutorial/create-a-slick-and-accessible-slideshow-using-jquery/</a><br />with just a couple of lines, it can make a slider, and it works nicely with blogger structure :) now I can add a nice looking slider to my blogger based portfolio<br />i can even keep the original post layout and just wrap the slider on top, it just slides the whole block :)<br /><br />Here's how:<br />simply look for the post loop in your blogger template, which is between <br /><pre>&lt;b:loop values=&quot;data:posts&quot; var=&quot;post&quot;&gt;<br />...<br />&lt;/b:loop&gt;<br /></pre>then wrap "slideshow" and "slideContainer" divs outside the loop and "slide" div inside the loop for each post<br />others pretty much copy and paste and edit those width and height to fit your site]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget 1.1</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/06/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-11.html</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Jun 2010 22:18:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="guild-recruitment"><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wordpress-plugin"><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-recruit-widget"><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=27</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>
<div>
<div>for more information about this plugin please go to:</div>
</div>
<div>
<div><a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/p/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget</a></div>
</div>
</strong></span></div>
<ul>
	<li><span style="color: red;"><strong>current stable release 1.1.4
</strong></span></li>
	<li><span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong>please save the widget once after upgrading from 1.0.x to make data work with new codes
</strong></span></strong></span></li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li>The 1.1.3 admin panel bug only happened to Internet Explorer due to an incomplete html tag (IE hides contents inside while all other browsers show contents inside), so if you are using Internet Explorer, please update to 1.1.4 to fix this bug.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li>Update 24/6/2010: eh.... took me ages to find the bug... turns out it is only missing a close "&gt;" so the drop down box breaks in certain browsers, namely, freaking Internet Explorer, come on, stop using IE guys! anyway, 1.1.4 released, enjoy.</li>
	<li>Update 23/6/2010: looks like there can be a bug on admin form on some servers, if you have problem using 1.1.x just revert back to 1.0.1 at the mean time. I'll upload a beta version to this page these few days, please stay tuned with this post thanks!</li>
	<li>Update 19/6/2010: fixed a bug that may cause by css float</li>
	<li>Update 19/6/2010: fixed a typo "Huner" and released 1.1.2 lol, also fixed some subversion stuffs, now it won't give you dead images if you need to revert to older versions.</li>
	<li>Update 18/6/2010: turns out there's really some bug on sorting algorithm also does not quite work on multi-site, I've fixed and released 1.1.1, it should work fine now, please comment here it doesn't work on your site :)</li>
	<li>Update 16/6/2010:  er ... the sorting algorithm is still buggy, I'll look into it again in the next update.</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size: x-large;">Description</span>

This version is updated to work with 3.0 single and multi site :)

I've revamped the whole widget and did a lot of changes to old codes, it should be way much cleaner than before.

<strong>New Features in 1.1:</strong>
<ul>
	<li>no more old school table layout, all are recoded with css2 (works on IE8 as well)</li>
	<li>since there is no more layout codes in the widget itself, custom layout can be done just by editing the css</li>
	<li>color and layout are seperated into 2 css files</li>
	<li>data structure is changed, old data will be changed to new structure automatically</li>
	<li>class icons are combined into css sprite</li>
	<li>new sorting method used, it should sort by status then class as intended now.</li>
</ul>
** row order in widget settings does not affect order that displays in front, it will just automatically sorts by status then class, I will improve this in future version

<strong>Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~</strong>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">Download from wordpress plugin gallery: <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/</a></div>
</div>
Full change log, plugin description after the break.

<a name="more"></a>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">Changelog</span></div>
= 1.1 =
* major recode to everything including data structure
* no more table layout, all replaced by div, which can be easily customized by editing css/layout.css
* color and layout are seperated into css/layout.css and css/color.css
* class icons are combined into css sprite
* new sorting method used, it should sort by status then class as intended now
= 1.1.1 =
* fixed a few non-set variable and duplicate function declaration bug, thanks Ramides
* fixed sorting mechanism, it should sort by status from high to low, then by class in alphabetical order, tell me if it is still bugged
= 1.1.2 =
* fixed a typing mistake "Huner", lol, thanks KGBAgent
= 1.1.3 =
* fixed a layout bug that may cause by css float
= 1.1.4 =
* fixed a lovely IE only bug, thanks KGBAgent again

<span style="font-size: x-large;">Future Improvements:</span>
<ul>
	<li>Custom order</li>
	<li>Custom status text</li>
	<li>More readable widget settings</li>
	<li>Able to toggle display/not display instead of hiding all “Closed” status</li>
	<li>Able to toggle usage of embedded style sheets</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

								<wp:comment>
		<wp:comment_id>9</wp:comment_id>
		<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Anonymous]]></wp:comment_author>
		<wp:comment_author_email></wp:comment_author_email>
		<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>

		<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I actually figured out how to add more lines.<br /><br />Edit the wow-recruit-widget.php file and look for the following line of code<br /><br />static $wr_max_row = 15;<br /><br />The default is 15 Lines, so for my site i changed it to 18.  The extra 3 lines let me show all class/spec combinations.<br /><br />the 1.1.4 update this morning seems to have fixed the issue with closed not being displayed but i was wondering if there was a way even if you have a status set to closed to still have it show up instead of be hidden?]]></wp:comment_content>

			</item>
		<item>
		<title>WOW Server Status WordPress Widget 1.0</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/06/wow-server-status-wordpress-widget-10.html</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 18 Jun 2010 20:46:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[server status]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="server-status"><![CDATA[server status]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wordpress-plugin"><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-server-status-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-server-status-widget"><![CDATA[wow-server-status-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=28</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #ff0000;">* 18/12/2010: confirmed it is breaking everywhere, appears blizzard has completely turned off the old xml realm status, maybe they've moved somewhere else, if that is the case it should be a quick fix. will look at it tomorrow</span>

<span style="color: red;">* 10/12/2010:  ok ok, yea I know Blizzard has changed their data and the badge is not working any more, thanks Blizzard! I'm still looking for solution, should be fixed within next 2 weeks.</span>

Easily add WOW Server Status 4.1 badge to your site by just a few clicks.
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;" href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBxnL7ANmLI/AAAAAAAAHBI/0CvFoMYjpuk/s1600/screenshot-1.jpg"><img src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBxnL7ANmLI/AAAAAAAAHBI/0CvFoMYjpuk/s320/screenshot-1.jpg" border="0" alt="" /></a></div>
<span style="font-size: x-large;">Description</span>
This is a simple widget that displays WOW Server Status 4.1 badge, without having to upload the script with ftp and write an img tag to run it.

The original script can be found here, which is not my work:
<a href="http://53x11.com/blog/2005/04/21/WoW-Server-Status-41.10">http://53x11.com/blog/2005/04/21/WoW-Server-Status-41.10</a>

If you managed to find bugs or want to correct some of my codes, please don't hesitate to leave a comment :)
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">Download from wordpress plugin gallery :): -- <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-server-status-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-server-status-widget/</a></div>
</div>
Full change log and descriptions after the break
<a name="more"></a>
<span style="font-size: x-large;">Installation</span>
1. Unpack and Upload all files to the `/wp-content/plugins/wow-server-status-widget` directory
2. Activate the plugin through the 'Plugins' menu in WordPress
3. Drag 'WOW Server Status Widget' to your sidebar
4. Enter details and done!
<span style="font-size: x-large;">
</span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;">Frequently Asked Questions</span>

The badge script is not my work, I just make it easy to drag and drop in wordpress.
It should be able to run properly on most servers, but if there is a problem
please visit <a href="http://53x11.com/blog/2005/04/21/WoW-Server-Status-41.10">http://53x11.com/blog/2005/04/21/WoW-Server-Status-41.10</a> and look for solutions there.

<strong>= It says "No Status Source", what's wrong? =</strong>
Make sure you check the realm name and region carefully, it won't work if you've typed it wrong.
If official realm status page: http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/realmstatus/compat.html is working fine, this badge should be working fine, in some rare cases like when they are upgrading server hardware or something, the realm page just breaks and so the badge will also break.

<strong>= It doesn't reflect the actual realm status correctly, what's wrong? =</strong>
See above. Also, update timer of this badge is set to 10 minutes, so it may not reflect immediately if the server status has just changed within 10 minutes.

<span style="font-size: x-large;">Changelog</span>

= 1.0.2 =
* fixed the quotation realm not showing bug in original wow_ss.php, thanks Nullinger

= 1.0.1 =
* better plugin path handling, added bug report icon, updated license wordings

= 1.0 =
* First released version]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget 1.2</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/07/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-12.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2010 01:15:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="guild-recruitment"><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wordpress-plugin"><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-recruit-widget"><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=29</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>
<div>
<div>for more information about this plugin please go to:</div>
</div>
<div>
<div><a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/p/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget</a></div>
</div>
</strong></span></div>
</div>
<ul>
	<li><span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong>please save the widget once after upgrading from 1.0.x to make data work with new code</strong></span></strong></span></li>
	<li><span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong> </strong></span></strong></span><span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong>
<div style="color: black; display: inline !important; font-weight: normal; margin: 0px;">
<div style="display: inline !important;">Update 1/8/2010: I've just written a post about customizing this widget with only css codes, have a look :)</div>
</div>
</strong></span></strong><strong><strong> </strong></strong><span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong> </strong></span></strong></span>
<span style="color: red;"><strong><span style="font-weight: normal;"><strong> </strong></span></strong></span>
<div style="color: black; display: inline !important; font-weight: normal; margin: 0px;"><strong><strong>
<div style="display: inline !important;"><a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html</a></div>
</strong></strong></div>
<strong><strong> </strong></strong><strong><strong> </strong></strong>

</span></li>
</ul>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">Description</span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">A widget that helps to display recruitment message of a World of Warcraft guild.</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">This version is updated and tested with 3.0.1 :)</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong>New Features in 1.2:</strong></div>
<ul>
	<li>option to use custom style sheet!</li>
	<li>fully customizable class / status texts! (yea I don't have much time to hard code multilingual support, so now you can do it all yourself :p)</li>
	<li>customizable number of rows! (yes it's official now)</li>
	<li>added in recruitment message</li>
	<li>added in a google ad to widget settings for my own good, lol, you can delete that line of code if you really don't like it.</li>
</ul>
<div style="margin: 0px;">** row order in widget settings does not affect order that displays in front, it will just automatically sorts by status then class, I will improve this in future version</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong>Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~</strong></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">Download from wordpress plugin gallery: <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">Full change log, plugin description after the break.</div>
<a name="more"></a>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">Changelog</span></div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">= 1.2.5 =
* there was some subversion mess up for previous 2 updates, I've recovered everything and this update should work properly

= 1.2.4 =
* fixed another issue about new generated wr-note class name, and a default style bug, also updated readme file
* removed google ad (sorry I was doing it wrong!)
* added a "help" icon that links to this plugin's new home page

= 1.2.3 =
* fixed a very minor potential issue about new generated wr-note class name, and a minor default style bug

= 1.2.2 =
* fixed another layout bug

= 1.2.1 =
* fixed a layout bug

= 1.2.0 =
* major update with new options panel
* option to use custom style sheet! and it is recombined back to one css
* fully customizable class / status texts!
* customizable number of rows!
* added in recruitment message

</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span>
<span style="font-size: x-large;">
<div style="font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span><span style="font-size: x-large;">Future Improvements:</span></span></div>
</div>
<ul style="font-size: medium;">
	<li>Custom order</li>
	<li>More readable widget settings</li>
	<li>Able to toggle display/not display instead of hiding all “Closed” status</li>
	<li>Different mode (maybe offer a more graphical layout)</li>
</ul>
</span></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-07-31 01:15:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-12</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_blog</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[ycfreeman.blogspot.com]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_author</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Freeman Manhttp://www.blogger.com/profile/00374233293777008327freegod725@yahoo.com.hk]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>blogger_permalink</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/2010/07/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-12.html]]></wp:meta_value>
