							</item>
		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget – Customization</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-customization.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 31 Jul 2010 20:44:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[css]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="css"><![CDATA[css]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="guild-recruitment"><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="web-design"><![CDATA[web design]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-recruit-widget"><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=30</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;">Introduction</span><br /><br />I had always been trying to make this widget really customizable in the first place, because I just don't want to make all of these wordpress sites look like those in Guild Launch or those Joomla sites out there. At one point I even thought about making a drag &amp; drop type of customization like Facebook, but it is just not feasible to do something like that with the time I want to spend on this plugin.<br /><br />So what I did is to make it fully customizable with some CSS techniques. This feature had been supported since 1.1 when I had got rid of all table layouts, today I finally have the time to write this tutorial after the release of 1.2.2<br /><br />This is a little tutorial of how to customize this widget, if you read through this, it may help you learn some CSS techniques as well.<br /><br />Before writing any codes, you will want to keep your changes right? so copy all style codes of the widget css (go to Plugins &gt; Editor &gt; Select plugin to edit: WOW Recruitment Widget &gt; wow-recruit-widget/css/style.css) copy everything inside, and paste to bottom of your theme css (Appearance &gt; Editor &gt; Select your theme &gt; style.css), then tick "Use Custom Style Sheet" in Settings &gt; WOW Recruit Widget.<br /><br />This will stop the widget style sheet from loading at all, which reduces a lot of conflicts and headache.<br /><br /><br /><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">&nbsp;then&nbsp;remember to point .wr-icon sprite to a correct image, i.e. if you want to use the default image sprite, change .wr-icon &gt; background-image to</div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><pre style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">url(../../plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)</pre></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">or using absolute link</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><br /></div></div><pre style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">url(http://{your site's url}/wp-content/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)</pre><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"></div></div></div><br /><br /><br /><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">** If you don't want to edit your theme style sheet, there is a plugin&nbsp;<a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/persistent-styles-plugin/">here</a>&nbsp;that helps you keep all your widget styles separated&nbsp;from your main theme style, I may consider including something like this in the future</div><div><br /></div><br />I'll separate this tutorial into 3 difficulty levels, in some WOW terms, Casual(Basic CSS), Intermediate(Advanced CSS), Hard Core(for Coders)<br /><br /><a name='more'></a><br /><span class="Apple-style-span" style="color: red;">*All screenshots are taken with chrome 5, but they should look the same (or very similar) on chrome 4+, firefox 3.5+ and safari 4+, opera does not support specific corner roundness thingy, so all will become rounded, Internet explorer does not support any css3 rounded corner and shadows (but it's hackable with <a href="http://css3pie.com/">filter</a>).</span><br /><br /><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;">Casual</span><br />So your guild just make you web master but you don't know any html or css,<br />and you just want to change some colors right? no worries, it's easy.<br />just find out the class that you want to change color, and replace the original color code to the new one you want, or even easier, add those lines to very bottom of your style sheet and they should do just fine.<br />That's how <a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_intro.asp">cascading style sheet</a> works, "the second mouse gets the cheese", latter rule always overwrite previous rule, if there is no special rule or id involved<br />which means, if you add your custom style code to very bottom to the only style sheet you have (aka the theme style sheet), those rules will always overwrite previous ones.<br /><br />say you have a white theme and want to change Priest class to something instead of white, and other classes to a darker tone,<br /><br />just change the corresponding color codes<br /><pre>.wr-priest { color: #FFFFFF; }</pre>to something else say grey<br /><pre>.wr-priest { color: #999999; }</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWmAYEYBI/AAAAAAAAHCM/3zsGLj1cL0g/s1600/beginner1.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWmAYEYBI/AAAAAAAAHCM/3zsGLj1cL0g/s320/beginner1.PNG" /></a></div><br />or background of each item (.wr-item) to a different color, just add in this line<br /><pre>.wr-item  { background:#222222;}</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWs50EbyI/AAAAAAAAHCU/8FpVBySK-G4/s1600/beginner2.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWs50EbyI/AAAAAAAAHCU/8FpVBySK-G4/s320/beginner2.PNG" /></a></div><br />or background of alternate item (.wr-odd, .wr-even) *yes I know CSS3 offers alternating row styling, but my plugin is using all divs so it may not suppoort seamlessly, and remember, IE8 doesn't support many CSS3 features<br /><pre>.wr-odd  { background:#999999;}<br />.wr-even  { background:#222222;}</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW1ZoBwxI/AAAAAAAAHCk/QFiEjHSP3Nk/s1600/beginner3.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW1ZoBwxI/AAAAAAAAHCk/QFiEjHSP3Nk/s320/beginner3.PNG" /></a></div><br />still doesn't look quite right? let's add a background for the whole widget<br /><pre>.wow-recruit-widget {<br /><br />        background:#111111;<br />        padding:10px;<br />}</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWwWi_YJI/AAAAAAAAHCc/4vP5reMCSpw/s1600/beginner4.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUWwWi_YJI/AAAAAAAAHCc/4vP5reMCSpw/s320/beginner4.PNG" /></a></div><br />looks a bit weird, let's add border to each item instead.<br /><pre>.wow-recruit-widget {<br /><br />        background:#111111;<br />        padding:10px;<br />}</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW6XBKJNI/AAAAAAAAHCs/QhGogWp429Y/s1600/beginner5.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW6XBKJNI/AAAAAAAAHCs/QhGogWp429Y/s320/beginner5.PNG" /></a></div><br />hmm, how about different border color, lol looks a bit like old school windows xp button<br /><pre>.wr-item {padding:5px;}<br />.wr-odd { background:#444444;<br />        border-top:3px solid #cccccc;<br />        border-left:3px solid #cccccc;<br />        border-right:3px solid #999999;<br />        border-bottom:3px solid #999999;<br />}<br />.wr-even {background:#222222;<br />        border-top:3px solid #cccccc;<br />        border-left:3px solid #cccccc;<br />        border-right:3px solid #666666;<br />        border-bottom:3px solid #666666;<br />}<br /></pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW-Lv68BI/AAAAAAAAHC0/wkMPpzV6prg/s1600/beginner6.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUW-Lv68BI/AAAAAAAAHC0/wkMPpzV6prg/s320/beginner6.PNG" /></a></div><br />now how about some rounded corners (it's css3 so... sorry IE fans.<br />-moz-border-radius is for Firefox, -webkit-border-radius is for Safari and Chrome, border-radius is css3 standard, since not all 3 browsers are supporting standard css3 yet, so it's better to have them all)<br /><pre>.wr-odd { background:#444444;<br />          border-top:3px solid #cccccc;<br />          border-left:3px solid #cccccc;<br />          border-right:3px solid #999999;<br />          border-bottom:3px solid #999999;<br />          -moz-border-radius:10px;<br />          -webkit-border-radius:10px;<br />          border-radius:10px;<br />}<br />.wr-even {background:#222222;<br />          border-top:3px solid #cccccc;<br />          border-left:3px solid #cccccc;<br />          border-right:3px solid #666666;<br />          border-bottom:3px solid #666666;<br />          -moz-border-radius:10px;<br />          -webkit-border-radius:10px;<br />          border-radius:10px;<br />}<br /></pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXB_2zazI/AAAAAAAAHC8/eM8gsaFPNNI/s1600/beginner7.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXB_2zazI/AAAAAAAAHC8/eM8gsaFPNNI/s320/beginner7.PNG" /></a></div><br />hmm how about rounded corner for those icons?<br /><pre>.wr-icon {<br />    border:2px solid #cccccc;<br />    -moz-border-radius:10px;<br />    -webkit-border-radius:10px;<br /><br />}<br /></pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXEhIvNEI/AAAAAAAAHDE/IgcqqVrEDBE/s1600/beginner8.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXEhIvNEI/AAAAAAAAHDE/IgcqqVrEDBE/s320/beginner8.PNG" /></a></div><br />hmm how about <a href="http://web.mit.edu/jmorzins/www/fonts.html">fonts</a>, I just don't like my theme default font for my widget<br /><pre>.wow-recruit-widget {<br /><br />    font-family:verdana;<br /><br />}</pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXNlSZ_UI/AAAAAAAAHDU/NrQvyd-NTg4/s1600/beginner9.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXNlSZ_UI/AAAAAAAAHDU/NrQvyd-NTg4/s320/beginner9.PNG" /></a></div><br />So I want different color for different spec text (1.2.2 I've made note has a class name corresponding to what you typed in the note, i.e. if you typed "Frost" in the note, the class of that note will be "wr-frost")<br />*note Death Knight becomes DKnight here, class texts are now fully customizable in 1.2.x, so you can change to whatever you want<br /><pre>.wr-frost                       { color:#409FFF;}<br />.wr-blood                       { color:#FF4F4F;}<br />.wr-feraltank                   { color:#52B2A5;}<br /><br />.wr-note                        {font-style:normal;}<br /></pre><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXQ2TpMCI/AAAAAAAAHDc/KVr_OmKWoCY/s1600/beginner10.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXQ2TpMCI/AAAAAAAAHDc/KVr_OmKWoCY/s320/beginner10.PNG" /></a></div><br /><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;">Intermediate</span><br />So you do know some html and css, but maybe not much php,&nbsp;enough for <a href="http://html-color-codes.com/">colors </a>and <a href="http://code.google.com/webfonts">fonts </a>as you probably know all of those already, since the outputs of this widget are all divs, we can do a lot more than that.<br /><br />At this point I assume you should know and understand<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/"> css syntax </a>, so I will only post important style codes for each examples below<br /><br />From here, a good <a href="http://notepad-plus-plus.org/">text editor with syntax highlighting</a> or even <a href="http://netbeans.org/">IDE with&nbsp;syntax checking</a> will help big time.<br /><br />Then you may want to <a href="http://www.wampserver.com/en/">work with a local</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://wordpress.org/">wordpress installation</a> before you put them onto your site.<br /><br />And if you want to make rounded corner and box shadow work in IE, you may want to have a look at <a href="http://css3pie.com/">PIE </a>, upload that to root folder of your server and add <br /><pre>behavior: url(/PIE.htc);</pre>to your rounded classes, and it should work, but it sometimes break in IE 6 if coupled with other filters like png filters and definitely not work at 5.x ....... that is, <a href="http://idroppedie6.com/">if you care about those ancient technologies</a>, believe me, your <a href="http://www.dailygame.net/forums/index.php?topic=375.0">target audiences</a> won't be using that 2002 computer that came with <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer#Internet_Explorer_6">those browsers</a><br /><br /><br />Ok let's go back to our tute.<br /><br />say you want something look like this, it looks like a big change? nah, it is still achievable by just editing a few classes!<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXWgTG5-I/AAAAAAAAHDk/_nJcOnK3x1U/s1600/intermediate1.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXWgTG5-I/AAAAAAAAHDk/_nJcOnK3x1U/s320/intermediate1.PNG" /></a></div><br /><pre>.wr-item {<br />    display:block;<br />    float:left;<br />    width:90px;<br />    height:65px;<br />    padding:0px;<br />    margin:2px;<br />    -moz-border-radius:10px;<br />    -webkit-border-radius:10px;<br />    border-radius:10px;<br />    -moz-border-radius-bottomright:0px;<br />    -webkit-border-bottom-right-radius:0px;<br />    -moz-box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px #666; /* Firefox */<br />    -webkit-box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px #666; /* Safari, Chrome */<br />    box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px #666; /* CSS3 */<br />    background:#444444;<br />}<br />.wr-odd {<br /><br /><br />}<br />.wr-even {<br /><br /><br />}<br />.wr-left {<br />    display:block;<br />    float: left;<br />    width: 25px;<br />    height: 30px;<br />    text-align:center;<br />}<br />.wr-right {<br />    display:block;<br />    float:left;<br />    height:30px;<br />    width:50px;<br />    position:relative;<br />}<br /><br /><br />.wr-class-text {<br />    display:block;<br />    margin-left:5px;<br />    height:30px;<br />    line-height:15px;<br />    width:40px;<br />    margin-top:5px;<br />    /*position:absolute;<br />    top:0px;<br />    left:0px;*/<br />}<br />.wr-status {<br />    display:block;<br />    margin-left:5px;<br />    height:15px;<br />    line-height:15px;<br />    width:20px;<br />    position:absolute;<br />    top:45px;<br />    left:-25px;<br />}<br />.wr-note {<br />    display:inline-block;<br />    font-weight:normal;<br />    font-style:italic;<br />    color:#cee683;<br />    line-height:15px;<br />    width:30px;<br />    height:15px;<br />    margin-left:5px;<br />    position:absolute;<br />    top:30px;<br />    left:-25px;<br />}<br /><br />.wr-icon {<br />    vertical-align:middle;<br />    width: 25px;<br />    height:25px;<br />    background:url(../../plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png);<br /><br />}<br /></pre>so you want to change the icon? no worries<br />(note that css background resizing is very problematic, so it's better not doing it, the work around is to resize .wr-icon class to fit the icon,&nbsp;or resize the icon image itself with paint or whatsoever,<br />hot linking image is not a very good practice, unless it's a very reliable source, code below is just an example)<br />note that here I've used .wr-icon.wr-deathknight, and removed background from .wr-icon, because if you only put background to .wr-deathknight, the background image will apply to class text block as well.<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXfcnBlDI/AAAAAAAAHDs/2HEC-06HiE0/s1600/intermediate2.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXfcnBlDI/AAAAAAAAHDs/2HEC-06HiE0/s320/intermediate2.PNG" /></a></div><br /><pre>.wr-icon {<br />    vertical-align:middle;<br />    width:40px;<br />    height:40px;<br />    position:absolute;<br />    top:-10px;<br />    left:-10px;<br />    background-position:center;<br />    background-repeat: no-repeat;<br />}<br />.wr-icon.wr-deathknight { background-image:url(http://area52.wowstead.com/files/icons/favicon/classround/class_deathknight.png);}<br /><br />.wr-icon.wr-druid   { background-image:url(http://area52.wowstead.com/files/icons/favicon/classround/class_druid.png);}<br /><br />.wr-icon.wr-priest  { background-image:url(http://area52.wowstead.com/files/icons/favicon/classround/class_priest.png);}<br />.wr-icon.wr-rogue  { background-image:url(http://area52.wowstead.com/files/icons/favicon/classround/class_rogue.png);}<br /></pre>I just think status is not very necessary<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXi7A0J2I/AAAAAAAAHD0/P1nce-Ja2e4/s1600/intermediate3.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXi7A0J2I/AAAAAAAAHD0/P1nce-Ja2e4/s320/intermediate3.PNG" /></a></div><br /><pre>.wr-status<br />{<br />    display:none;<br />}<br /><br />.wr-item<br />{<br />    height:50px;<br />}<br /></pre>nope I changed my mind, I don't want class text instead.<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXmDgeEkI/AAAAAAAAHD8/9N0UliKh9ek/s1600/intermediate4.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TFUXmDgeEkI/AAAAAAAAHD8/9N0UliKh9ek/s320/intermediate4.PNG" /></a></div><br /><pre>.wr-item<br />{<br />    height:40px;<br />}<br /><br />.wr-status {<br />    display:block;<br />    margin-left:5px;<br />    height:15px;<br />    line-height:15px;<br />    width:20px;<br />   /*position:absolute;<br />    top:45px;<br />    left:-25px;*/<br />}<br /><br />.wr-note {<br />    display:block;<br />    font-weight:normal;<br />    font-style:italic;<br />    color:#cee683;<br />    line-height:15px;<br />    width:30px;<br />    height:15px;<br />    margin-left:5px;<br />    /*position:absolute;<br />    top:30px;<br />    left:-25px;*/<br />}<br /><br />.wr-class-text {<br />    display:none;<br />}<br /><br /></pre><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: x-large; white-space: normal;">Hard Core</span><br />hey you are coder already what do you need me to teach you? you maybe better than me already<br /><br /><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">At this point you may notice, I have only used very few&nbsp;<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/">css</a>&nbsp;properties, not even used much&nbsp;<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_positioning.asp">positioning</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_float.asp">float</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/pr_pos_z-index.asp">z-index</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_align.asp">alignment</a>, etc, as well as&nbsp;<a href="http://www.css3.info/preview/">css3</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://www.css3.com/">stuffs</a>&nbsp;like transform(rotate), alpha, text shadow, etc and I haven't used any graphic manipulation tools at all for the whole article.<br /><br /></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">so you can even do more if you can do some graphic manipulation, like adding gradient backgrounds, (<a href="http://www.zenelements.com/blog/css3-gradients/">css3 gradient</a> is not supported by quite a few browsers yet, so I don't recommend that option), make cooler icons, etc etc.</div><br />ok something more for you. that is, wordpress gives each widget a unique id, say your 10 man recruit widget is wow-recruit-widget-6 and 25 man one is wow-recruit-widget-9,<br />you can style individual widget with its own class by specifying css id, check your browser's developer tool for the actual div id on the generated html<br /><br /><pre>#wow-recruit-widget-6 .wow-recruit<br />{<br />    /*something something*/<br />}<br /><br />#wow-recruit-widget-9 .wr-item<br />{<br />    /*something something*/<br />}<br /><br /></pre><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;">Conclusion</span><br />so you can pretty much break the whole layout and reconstruct as long as they are still having the same elements, or if you know jQuery or know how to use DOM model with other javascript libraries, you can even replace those elements with what you want. here I won't say much about those, since if it requires so much code, it loses the point of plug in already.<br /><br />at this point I have no plan to make a more graphical version for this widget, like with more icons instead of texts<br /><br />hope this tutorial helps to customize your WOW Recruitment Widget, and maybe you've learnt some css here, if you like this article about css, feel free to leave a comment here or recommend to your friends<br /><br />Oh yeah, share with me with your cool looking themes! :)<br /><br />Have fun!<br /><br /><br /><br /><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;">Appendix</span><br /><br /><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><b>CSS Block Structure for reference:</b></div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">wow-recruit-widget</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">|wr-container</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||wr-item wr-odd</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">|||wr-left</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||||wr-icon wr-shaman</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">|||wr-right</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||||wr-class-text wr-shaman</div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||||wr-note</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||||wr-status wr-High</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">||wr-item wr-even</div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><br /></div></div><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><div style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"><b>Default Layout (lines below illustrate CSS block structure):</b></div></div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 0px; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBw3Uj7uOJI/AAAAAAAAHBA/Bqit2noV9-k/s1600/Capture.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="400" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBw3Uj7uOJI/AAAAAAAAHBA/Bqit2noV9-k/s400/Capture.JPG" width="315" /></a></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[AXE5Zn  <a href="http://bgqampbfvswr.com/" rel="nofollow">bgqampbfvswr</a>, [url=http://eqmqzwoyssqo.com/]eqmqzwoyssqo[/url], [link=http://hwpxetdwediy.com/]hwpxetdwediy[/link], http://fnxsbcyivoft.com/]]></wp:comment_content>
		<wp:comment_approved>spam</wp:comment_approved>
		<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>
		<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
		<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
				<wp:comment>
		<wp:comment_id>70</wp:comment_id>
		<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[paphiniillurb]]></wp:comment_author>
		<wp:comment_author_email>elaina12newland@gmail.com</wp:comment_author_email>
		<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>
		<wp:comment_author_IP>77.93.27.87</wp:comment_author_IP>
		<wp:comment_date>2010-12-19 08:00:40</wp:comment_date>
		<wp:comment_date_gmt>2010-12-18 22:00:40</wp:comment_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hello. I found nice theme here:
<a href="http://chipshospitality.com/discussion/index.php?topic=66266.new#new" rel="nofollow">link</a>
<a href="http://www.elektro-klub.ru/forum/viewtopic.php?p=126101#126101" rel="nofollow">link</a>

Maybe somebody can help me?
Thanks and Bye]]></wp:comment_content>
		<wp:comment_approved>spam</wp:comment_approved>
		<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>
		<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
		<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
			</item>
		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget 1.3</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/09/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget-13.html</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 10 Sep 2010 19:29:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="guild-recruitment"><![CDATA[guild recruitment]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[php]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="widget"><![CDATA[widget]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wordpress-plugin"><![CDATA[wordpress plugin]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="world-of-warcraft"><![CDATA[world of warcraft]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="wow-recruit-widget"><![CDATA[wow-recruit-widget]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=31</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong>for more information about this plugin please go to:</strong></div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong><a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/p/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget</a></strong>

</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">Description</span></div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">A widget that helps to display recruitment message of a World of Warcraft guild.</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">This version is updated and tested with 3.0.x :)</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong>New Features in 1.3:</strong></div>
</div>
<ul>
	<li>Customizable tooltip! opens up even more layout possibilities!</li>
	<li>Bug report icon which links to the latest blog post of current version</li>
	<li>Able to display "Closed" status! (not in a very smart way, so be careful while using it)</li>
</ul>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><strong>Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~</strong></div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">If you would like to support this project, please consider
<form style="display: inline;" action="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr" method="post"> <input name="cmd" type="hidden" value="_s-xclick" /> <input name="hosted_button_id" type="hidden" value="2N2SQX46GFBWC" /> <input alt="PayPal - The safer, easier way to pay online." name="submit" src="https://www.paypal.com/en_AU/i/btn/btn_donate_SM.gif" type="image" /><img style="display: none;" src="https://www.paypal.com/en_AU/i/scr/pixel.gif" border="0" alt="" width="1" height="1" /></form>, I will give you my Troll hug :)

</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">Download from wordpress plugin gallery: <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/</a></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">Full change log, plugin description after the break.</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<a name="more"></a>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">What's New in 1.3</span></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;"><strong>1. Customizable tooltip</strong></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">Tooltip was added last version and in this version I've made it customizable with pattern.</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><a style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;" href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGQ1T1paI/AAAAAAAAHFI/vzngvIWBf00/s1600/Capture.jpg"><img src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGQ1T1paI/AAAAAAAAHFI/vzngvIWBf00/s320/Capture.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="320" height="268" /></a></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-small;">Figure 1.1 v1.3 widget settings</span></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">Figure 1.1 shows a new option under widget settings, where you can customize tooltip with tokens, mind that these tokens are case sensitive.</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">[class] - will be replaced with customized class text</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">[status] - will be replaced with customized status text</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">[note] - will be replaced with customized note</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">say you have a pattern like [class] | [note] | [status]</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">then you will see something like Death Knight | Blood | Medium when you roll your mouse cursor onto a recruitment item</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><a style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;" href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGWEAs_dI/AAAAAAAAHFY/tXujq5OAehk/s1600/Untitled-1.jpg"><img src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGWEAs_dI/AAAAAAAAHFY/tXujq5OAehk/s320/Untitled-1.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="320" height="224" /></a></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-small;">Figure 1.2 v1.3 customizable tooltip</span></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: small;">
</span></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><a style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;" href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsRn4bbsRI/AAAAAAAAHFg/HjDGvUr1JN8/s1600/Capture3.jpg"><img src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsRn4bbsRI/AAAAAAAAHFg/HjDGvUr1JN8/s320/Capture3.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="320" height="188" /></a></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center; margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-small;">Figure 1.3 one possible usage</span></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">so what's so cool about it?</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">with the ability to put all those texts to tooltip, now it makes more sense to make a pure icon based recruitment message with my widget! some possible usage will be like Figure 1.3</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left; margin: 0px;">(note that I've also added note and status css class to item wrapper, so it is now very easy to use different icon/style for different spec, and setting different style for different status)</div>
<pre>.wr-status3 .wr-icon { opacity:1.0; }.wr-status2 .wr-icon { opacity:0.6; }.wr-status1 .wr-icon { opacity:0.3; }.wr-status0 .wr-icon { opacity:0.0; }

.wr-icon {border:3px solid #cccccc; border-radius:10px; width:40px; height:40px;}.wr-item {padding:5px; width:40px; height:40px;}.wr-note, .wr-status, .wr-class-text{display:none;}.wr-deathknight .wr-blood  .wr-icon {border:3px solid #C41F3B; background:url(http://vnmedia.ign.com/wowvault.ign.com/icons/Spell_Deathknight_BloodPresence_sm.png) no-repeat; }.wr-deathknight .wr-frost  .wr-icon {border:3px solid #0C81CE; background:url(http://vnmedia.ign.com/wowvault.ign.com/icons/Spell_Deathknight_UnholyPresence_sm.png) no-repeat;}.wr-deathknight .wr-unholy .wr-icon  {border:3px solid green; background:url(http://vnmedia.ign.com/wowvault.ign.com/icons/Spell_Deathknight_FrostPresence_sm.png) no-repeat;}.wr-shaman.wr-elemental .wr-icon {border:3px solid #2459FF; background:url(http://www.sicaine.net/wowprofiler/img/Interface/Icons/Spell_Nature_Lightning.png) no-repeat; }.wr-shaman .wr-resto .wr-icon {border:3px solid green; background:url(http://www.hotwow.com/icons/middle/Spell_Nature_HealingWaveGreater.jpg) no-repeat;}</pre>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">well, you get the idea if you have read <a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">the customization post</a> :)</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;"><strong>2. Added an option to display "Closed" status</strong></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">I've added this option in a super simple way, just a tick box in plugin settings that enables all "Closed" status to display in front. If this box is checked, it will make all "Closed" status to display.</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;">Say you have 15 rows of  Death Knight in "Closed" status (which is default option of the widget), checking that box will make them all displaying, so you have to set "Rows" in widget settings to a proper row number if this option is turned on.</div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;" href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGUw_OmkI/AAAAAAAAHFQ/fV3LSC-314Q/s1600/Capture2.JPG"><img src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TIsGUw_OmkI/AAAAAAAAHFQ/fV3LSC-314Q/s320/Capture2.JPG" border="0" alt="" width="320" height="217" /></a></div>
<div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: x-small;">Figure 2.1 added option to display "Closed" status</span></div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;">Changelog</span></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">

= 1.3.1 =
* changed help/bug icons to host at external source, updated license wordings

</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">= 1.3.0 =</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">* customizable tooltip!</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">* ability to enable display of "closed" status!</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">* bug report icon!</div>
</div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"> </span></div>
<div style="font-size: medium; margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;">
<div style="margin: 0px;"><span style="font-size: x-large;"><span><span style="font-size: x-large;">Future Improvements:</span></span></span></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul><span>
	<li>Custom order</li>
	<li>More readable widget settings</li>
</span></ul>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>32</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-09-26 09:01:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-09-25 23:01:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>ie-is-being-mean-to-me</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_blog</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[ycfreeman.blogspot.com]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_author</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Freeman Manhttp://www.blogger.com/profile/00374233293777008327freegod725@yahoo.com.hk]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>blogger_permalink</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/2010/09/ie-is-being-mean-to-me.html]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1292341741]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_shortUrl</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[http://b2l.me/a99zgg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_permaHash</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[4ca7ec1ef90a51a2675b28dee2d47347]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
								<wp:comment>

			</item>
		<item>
		<title>Migrating to WordPress :)</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/12/migrating-to-hosted-wordpress.html</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Dec 2010 07:26:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[random]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="random"><![CDATA[random]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?p=33</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Finally, I've got my own hosted space, lol.

It's been a bit awkward to code Wordpress plugins while I'm not using Wordpress for my own site :p.

space already purchased, domain will stay the same, changes to all my plugin readme files will be done as soon as I've set it up on the other side.

Demo site will be setup properly, no more cheapo "free site suspended" messages...

and I'll also setup a forum for Supporting issues, so no more old school emails or un-threaded comments!

This side will be changed back to ycfreeman.blogspot.com until all migrations are done,
while domain will be moved to new site soon for easier setup

Stay tuned for updates!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/about</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Dec 2010 14:08:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignleft" style="border: 0px initial initial;" title="I'm Freeman Man!!" src="http://en.gravatar.com/userimage/10631549/8f56271f56c148f4aaa1b96b17f1698c.jpg?size=200" border="0" alt="" width="200" height="200" />

Hi there, this is Freeman.

I was graduated from University of Queensland Information Technology, major database systems and had been playing with many web related tools and technologies for years.

Now I'm doing html/css/javascript/asp.net stuffs for a living :)
<div>

Recently I have been playing with different php content management systems to reduce maintenance required for my own websites, and starting to write some Wordpress plugins and themes.

oh, and I play World of Warcraft :)

For the Horde! Lok'tar Ogar!

</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2</wp:post_id>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>WOW Recruitment Widget</title>
		<link>http://www.ycfreeman.com/wow-recruitment-widget</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Dec 2010 14:55:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Freeman Man]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.ycfreeman.com</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to the home page of <strong>WOW Recruitment Wordpress Widget (</strong><strong>wow-recruit-widget</strong>)

<strong> </strong>
<div>

14/12/2010: started 1.4 update these days, hopefully can be done during holidays (been actually playing wow these days :p)

24/10/2010: From now on I'll post in comments for teasers, or some workable ideas that come up in my mind about this plugin, (like when I have time to post a few lines but not enough to actually update the widget :p), so check back once a while or subscribe if you have a google account/ if it works :) blogger doesn't seem to have a comment feed which you can subscribe yet, it seems to work on gmail only at the moment.

new major updates will still be in the form of new blog posts, so you can check out major updates by subscribing to feed. I'll try to keep my blog updates relevant (lol about that IE post, cuz it's too awesome).

WOW Recruitment Widget is a wordpress widget based plugin that helps to display recruitment message of a World of Warcraft guild.
<div>
<div><strong>Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~</strong></div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>If you would like to support this project, please consider</strong>

<form action="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr" method="post"> <input alt="PayPal - The safer, easier way to pay online." name="submit" src="https://www.paypal.com/en_AU/i/btn/btn_donate_SM.gif" type="image" /></form><strong>, I will give you my Goblin hug :)</strong>

</div>
</div>
<span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Demo site is here:</strong></span><a href="http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/"> http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/</a> (it's very unstable now, it will be updated soon)

<span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>version 1.3 is out, check out the new features!: </strong></span>

[catlist id=20,-16 numberposts=1]

</div>
Download latest version from your Wordpress site plugin panel or from Wordpress Plugin Directory:

<a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/">http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/</a>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBw0EwSiaRI/AAAAAAAAHA4/naLsfMg5xoU/s1600/Capture.JPG"><img src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TBw0EwSiaRI/AAAAAAAAHA4/naLsfMg5xoU/s320/Capture.JPG" border="0" alt="" /></a></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>default look (excluding background colour)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw5Mpl_FI/AAAAAAAAHH0/MOgQmwDwtBM/s1600/widget.jpg"><img src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw5Mpl_FI/AAAAAAAAHH0/MOgQmwDwtBM/s320/widget.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="294" height="320" /></a></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>widget setting</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw4MW3ANI/AAAAAAAAHHw/rqlGbaA__TU/s1600/settings.jpg"><img src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw4MW3ANI/AAAAAAAAHHw/rqlGbaA__TU/s320/settings.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="135" height="320" /></a></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>settings menu</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw3tBeEQI/AAAAAAAAHHs/LRTofSA8EQA/s1600/options.jpg"><img src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_qDb3uKm69NY/TMMw3tBeEQI/AAAAAAAAHHs/LRTofSA8EQA/s320/options.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="239" height="320" /></a></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>admin settings page for "translations" etc</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3><span style="font-size: x-large;">Customization</span><strong><span style="font-size: x-large;">:</span></strong></h3>
Demo site with a few example style (best viewed on chrome4+ /safari4+, or latest FF3+/Opera10+/IE9)

<a rel="nofollow" href="http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/">http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/</a>

Customization (with pure CSS) tutorial:

<a href="http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html">http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html</a>

<strong>
</strong>
<h3><span style="font-size: x-large;">Detailed Description</span></h3>
<div>
<div>

Widget Settings:

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>Title: the title of the widget (optional)</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

-- The title bar will be hidden if Title is empty.

</div>
<div>

<strong><span>
</span>Recruitment URL: links to your recruitment page (optional).</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

-- The whole box will become clickable and links to the URL if Title URL is specified.

</div>
<div>

<strong><span>
</span>Recruitment Message: some message between title and the list (optional)</strong><strong>
Class: List of classes, so it is possible to make multiple entries for same class</strong>.

</div>
<div>

<strong><span>
</span>Status: consist of High, Medium, Low, Closed.</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

-- The class will not be displayed if status is Closed.

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

Note: additional note for the recruitment message (usually for different spec of the class).

</div>
<div>

Plugin Options:

<strong>Use Custom Style Sheet:</strong>

-- checking this will stop default style sheet from loading

</div>
<div>

If you managed to find bugs or typos, please feel free to leave a comment here.

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<h3><span><span style="font-size: x-large;">Installation</span></span></h3>
</div>
</div>
<ol>
	<li>Unpack and Upload all files to the `/wp-content/plugins/wow-recruit-widget` directory</li>
	<li>Activate the plugin through the 'Plugins' menu in WordPress</li>
	<li>Drag 'WOW Recruitment Widget' to your sidebar</li>
	<li>Enter details and done!</li>
	<li>(optional) go to Settings &amp;gt; WOW Recruit Widget to set up all classes and status texts to your own language</li>
</ol>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3><span><span style="font-size: x-large;">Frequently Asked Questions</span></span></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>= These color/font/size does not match my template, can I change them? =</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

Yes, copy all contents in the widget style.css to your theme style.css, then choose "Use Custom Style Sheet" in admin panel, and remember to point .wr-icon sprite to a correct image, i.e. if you want to use the default image sprite, change .wr-icon &amp;gt; background-image to

</div>
<pre>url(../../plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)</pre>
</div>
<div>
<div>

or using absolute link
<pre>url(http://{your site's url}/wp-content/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)</pre>
<strong>
</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>= I don't want the icon class note to layout like that, can I change it? =</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

Yes, all layouts are done with css, please refer to the latest plugin URL for some useful links and examples

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>
</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

<strong>= Can I sort recruitment messages in another way? =</strong>

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>

Unfortunately no, please leave me a comment if you want this feature :).

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>Version History:</h3>
[catlist id=20,-16]
<h3>Bed Time Readings...</h3>
<div>

It first started with a really simple widget only for displaying some recruitment message, since there was nearly no plugins doing something I want in the wordpress plugin directory, which look nice on my guild site, and can be used easily by not-so-IT officers in my own guild.

</div>
<div>

Since 1.1 - seems there are quite a number of sites using this widget by that time, I thought it would be a bit boring if it is not customizable, after all I thought it would lost the point of having wonderful looking Wordpress site if they all look like those Joomla WOW sites with the same set, same looking plugins out there, so it was then designed to be highly customizable with very little CSS techniques to meet most design needs for individual Wordpress website/blog.

</div>
<div>

Since 1.2 - seems some sites using this widget are based on non-english contents, it would look weird to have English only on this widget, so it was then designed to be customizable for almost all texts so you can enter any information into those "recruitment" slots, and thus able to achieve multilingual support or even easily tailored for non-world of warcraft related uses.

</div>
</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to the home page of WOW Recruitment Wordpress Widget (wow-recruit-widget)

 


14/12/2010: started 1.4 update these days, hopefully can be done during holidays (been actually playing wow these days :p)

24/10/2010: From now on I’ll post in comments for teasers, or some workable ideas that come up in my mind about this plugin, (like when I have time to post a few lines but not enough to actually update the widget :p), so check back once a while or subscribe if you have a google account/ if it works :) blogger doesn’t seem to have a comment feed which you can subscribe yet, it seems to work on gmail only at the moment.

new major updates will still be in the form of new blog posts, so you can check out major updates by subscribing to feed. I’ll try to keep my blog updates relevant (lol about that IE post, cuz it’s too awesome).

WOW Recruitment Widget is a wordpress widget based plugin that helps to display recruitment message of a World of Warcraft guild.

Thank you for all your support, stay tuned for updates~




If you would like to support this project, please consider

 , I will give you my Goblin hug :)



Demo site is here: http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/ (it’s very unstable now, it will be updated soon)

version 1.3 is out, check out the new features!: 

[catlist id=20,-16 numberposts=1]


Download latest version from your Wordpress site plugin panel or from Wordpress Plugin Directory:

http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/








default look (excluding background colour)











widget setting









settings menu









admin settings page for “translations” etc



Customization:
Demo site with a few example style (best viewed on chrome4+ /safari4+, or latest FF3+/Opera10+/IE9)

http://ycfreeman.x10.mx/

Customization (with pure CSS) tutorial:

http://www.ycfreeman.com/2010/08/wow-recruitment-wordpress-widget.html



Detailed Description



Widget Settings:






Title: the title of the widget (optional)






– The title bar will be hidden if Title is empty.





Recruitment URL: links to your recruitment page (optional).






– The whole box will become clickable and links to the URL if Title URL is specified.





Recruitment Message: some message between title and the list (optional)
Class: List of classes, so it is possible to make multiple entries for same class.





Status: consist of High, Medium, Low, Closed.






– The class will not be displayed if status is Closed.






Note: additional note for the recruitment message (usually for different spec of the class).




Plugin Options:

Use Custom Style Sheet:

– checking this will stop default style sheet from loading




If you managed to find bugs or typos, please feel free to leave a comment here.





Installation



	Unpack and Upload all files to the `/wp-content/plugins/wow-recruit-widget` directory
	Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
	Drag ‘WOW Recruitment Widget’ to your sidebar
	Enter details and done!
	(optional) go to Settings > WOW Recruit Widget to set up all classes and status texts to your own language




Frequently Asked Questions






= These color/font/size does not match my template, can I change them? =






Yes, copy all contents in the widget style.css to your theme style.css, then choose “Use Custom Style Sheet” in admin panel, and remember to point .wr-icon sprite to a correct image, i.e. if you want to use the default image sprite, change .wr-icon > background-image to


url(../../plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)




or using absolute link
url(http://{your site’s url}/wp-content/plugins/wow-recruit-widget/img/class-sprite.png)








= I don’t want the icon class note to layout like that, can I change it? =






Yes, all layouts are done with css, please refer to the latest plugin URL for some useful links and examples














= Can I sort recruitment messages in another way? =






Unfortunately no, please leave me a comment if you want this feature :).





Version History:
[catlist id=20,-16]
Bed Time Readings…


It first started with a really simple widget only for displaying some recruitment message, since there was nearly no plugins doing something I want in the wordpress plugin directory, which look nice on my guild site, and can be used easily by not-so-IT officers in my own guild.




Since 1.1 - seems there are quite a number of sites using this widget by that time, I thought it would be a bit boring if it is not customizable, after all I thought it would lost the point of having wonderful looking Wordpress site if they all look like those Joomla WOW sites with the same set, same looking plugins out there, so it was then designed to be highly customizable with very little CSS techniques to meet most design needs for individual Wordpress website/blog.




Since 1.2 - seems some sites using this widget are based on non-english contents, it would look weird to have English only on this widget, so it was then designed to be customizable for almost all texts so you can enter any information into those “recruitment” slots, and thus able to achieve multilingual support or even easily tailored for non-world of warcraft related uses.



]]></content:encoded>
